user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of digest_get_hash_size:
```c
_MHD_static_inline size_t
digest_get_hash_size (enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3 algo3)
{
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  mhd_assert (MHD_MD5_DIGEST_SIZE == MD5_DIGEST_SIZE);
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  mhd_assert (MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE == SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE);
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#ifdef MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT
  mhd_assert (MHD_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE == SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE);
#ifdef MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT
  mhd_assert (SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE == SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE);
#endif /* MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT */
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
  /* Only one algorithm must be specified */
  mhd_assert (1 == \
              (((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5)) ? 1 : 0)   \
               + ((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)) ? 1 : 0)   \
               + ((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256)) ? 1 : 0)));
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5)))
    return MHD_MD5_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#if defined(MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT) && defined(MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ( ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)
                | ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256))))
    return MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE; /* The same as SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE */
  else
#elif defined(MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)))
    return MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#elif defined(MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256)))
    return MHD_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
    (void) 0; /* Unsupported algorithm */

  return 0; /* Wrong input or unsupported algorithm */
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function digest_get_hash_size:
#define MHD_MD5_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT 1
...
#define MHD_MD5_DIGEST_SIZE 16
...
#define MD5_DIGEST_SIZE (MD5_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*MD5_BYTES_IN_WORD)
...
#define MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE 32
...
#define SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE (SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*SHA256_BYTES_IN_WORD)
...
#define MHD_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE 32
...
#define SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE (SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE_WORDS*SHA512_256_BYTES_IN_WORD)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags:
mhd_assert (1 == \
              (((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5)) ? 1 : 0)   \
               + ((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)) ? 1 : 0)   \
               + ((0 != (algo3 & MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256)) ? 1 : 0)));
#ifdef MHD_MD5_SUPPORT
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_MD5)))
    return MHD_MD5_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#endif /* MHD_MD5_SUPPORT */
#if defined(MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT) && defined(MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ( ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)
                | ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256))))
    return MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE; /* The same as SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE */
  else
#elif defined(MHD_SHA256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA256)))
    return MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#elif defined(MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT)
  if (0 != (((unsigned int) algo3)
            & ((unsigned int) MHD_DIGEST_BASE_ALGO_SHA512_256)))
    return MHD_SHA512_256_DIGEST_SIZE;
  else
#endif /* MHD_SHA512_256_SUPPORT */
    (void) 0; /* Unsupported algorithm */

  return 0; /* Wrong input or unsupported algorithm */
explanation: Fragments NOT listed were considered not suspicious for unreachable-code and therefore need not be investigated: the small size-consistency asserts for MD5 and SHA256 (e.g. mhd_assert (MHD_MD5_DIGEST_SIZE == MD5_DIGEST_SIZE); mhd_assert (MHD_SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE == SHA256_DIGEST_SIZE);) are simple platform/consistency checks and do not contain control flow that could be unreachable. The function signature, comments, and the general structure around the conditional compilation directives themselves are not flagged because reachability depends on the chosen configuration; the listed fragments capture all places where control flow may be impossible or ambiguous in the compiled project (the algorithm-selection assert, the algorithm-specific if/return chains including the combined SHA256|SHA512 block, the final '(void) 0' unsupported path, and the final 'return 0'). These are the locations that should be examined to determine whether any code in the final build is actually unreachable (for example: preprocessor configurations that make some branches impossible, or the assertion that enforces exactly one algorithm which could make the 'unsupported' path dead). No other lines in the function contain control-flow constructs that would be candidates for unreachable-code under the provided configuration.
